com.rawva.util

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rawva.util.StringUtils

  • public class StringUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides various operations on strings.
    Author:
    Raymond Tang

    • Constructor Detail

      • StringUtils

        public StringUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • capitalize

        public static java.lang.String capitalize(java.lang.String s)
        Converts the first letter of the specified string to upper case. If the specified string is empty, then the empty string is returned. If the first letter of the specified string is already capitalized, then the specified string is returned as is.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to capitalize
        Returns:
        a copy of the specified string with the first letter converted to upper case, or the empty string if the specified string is empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified string is null

      • getMostFrequentCharacter

        public static char getMostFrequentCharacter(java.lang.String s)
        Returns the character that occurs the most frequently in the specified string. If there is a tie, the most frequent character that appears earliest in the string is returned.

        Examples:

        "abb" -> 'b'
        "$def$" -> '$'
        "abc" -> 'a'
        Parameters:
        s - the string in which to find the most frequent character
        Returns:
        the character that occurs the most frequently in the specified string
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified string is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified string is empty

      • permute

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> permute(java.lang.String s)
        Computes all permutations of the specified string and returns them in a set. If the specified string is null, then an empty set is returned. If the specified string is empty, then a set containing the empty string is returned.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to permute
        Returns:
        a set containing all permutations of the specified string

      • sort

        public static java.lang.String sort(java.lang.String s)
        Sorts the specified string by its characters in lexicographical order.

        Examples:

        "cba" -> "abc"
        "21354" -> "12345"
        Parameters:
        s - the string to sort
        Returns:
        the sorted string
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified string is null
